pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

lessons.japanese: 家の支払いのため僕らは倹約しなければならないだろう。
lessons.english: To make our house payments, we're going to have to tighten our belts.

lessons.japanese: 彼女はけちと言わないまでも倹約家だ。
lessons.english: She is frugal, not to say stingy.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は、ケチとは言わないまでも、非常に倹約家だ。
lessons.english: She is very frugal, not to say stingy.

lessons.japanese: 彼は控え目に言っても倹約家だ。
lessons.english: He is frugal, to say the least of it.

lessons.japanese: 彼は金をためるため何年間もけちけち倹約した。
lessons.english: He pinched and scraped for many years to save money.

lessons.japanese: 彼はけちと言わないまでもとても倹約家だ。
lessons.english: He is very frugal, not to say stingy.

lessons.japanese: 彼はけちとは言わないまでも倹約家だ。
lessons.english: He is thrifty, not to say stingy.

lessons.japanese: 彼はかなり裕福だが倹約家だ。その点では父親に似てる。
lessons.english: Though he is fairly well off, he is frugal; he takes after his father in that respect.

lessons.japanese: 生活費は高い、だから私たちは倹約しなければならない。
lessons.english: Living is dear, accordingly we have to economize.

lessons.japanese: 収入が低いと倹約せざるを得なくなる。
lessons.english: A small income obliges us to thrift.

lessons.japanese: 倹約なんて私の性質上できないことだ。
lessons.english: Thrift is alien to my nature.

lessons.japanese: 倹約するのも大いに結構だが、彼は極端である。
lessons.english: It is all very well to be frugal; but he goes too far.

lessons.japanese: 家の支払いのため僕らは倹約しなければならないだろう。
lessons.english: To make our house payments, we're going to have to tighten our belts.
